sect1.title: Build Flags
sect1.para: We will need to setup target specific flags for the compiler and linkers.

screen.userinput: export BUILD32="-mabi=32" export BUILDN32="-mabi=n32" export BUILD64="-mabi=64"

sect1.para: You will need to set your host target triplet for o32 bit:

screen.userinput: if [ "${LFS_HOST}" = "${LFS_TARGET32}" ]; then \ echo "Host and Target can't be the same." ; fi

sect1.para: If the above test gave you "Host and Target can't be the same", you will need to change your LFS_HOST to a a different target triplet:
Lets add the build flags to ~/.bashrc to prevent issues if we stop and come back later.

screen.userinput: echo export BUILD32=\""${BUILD32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export BUILDN32=\""${BUILDN32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export BUILD64=\""${BUILD64}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_TARGET32=\""${LFS_TARGET32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_HOST=\""${LFS_HOST}\"" >> ~/.bashrc
